intro: Galium jordanii subsp. gracilentum, commonly known as Jordan's bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Galium jordanii subsp. gracilentum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
